meanings.definition: The state of the atmosphere at a place and time as regards heat, dryness, sunshine, wind, rain, etc.
meanings.sent1: The weather today is sunny and warm.
meanings.sent2: I always check the weather forecast before planning a picnic.
meanings.sent3: The weather decided to play a trick on us by suddenly turning cold in the middle of summer.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like the weather, changing from sunny to stormy in an instant.
meanings.sent5: The weather in the desert can be extreme, with scorching heat during the day and freezing cold at night.

meanings.definition: To come safely through a storm or difficult period.
meanings.sent1: We managed to weather the financial crisis and come out stronger.
meanings.sent2: The old house was able to weather many hurricanes over the years.
meanings.sent3: Despite the challenges, they were able to weather the storm with a positive attitude.
meanings.sent4: She helped her friend weather the emotional turmoil by being a supportive listener.
meanings.sent5: Their friendship was able to weather any disagreement, standing strong through thick and thin.
